title: Test Issue for External Intake Validation
description:
# Test Issue for External Intake Validation

## Summary
This is a fake issue created to validate the `get_extern_issue.py` workflow end to end.

## Context
We need a predictable external issue to test how YODA Intake consumes external data and stores it locally in `yoda/project/extern-issues/`.

## Objective
Confirm that `get_extern_issue.py` can fetch this issue metadata/body and generate a valid local JSON artifact for agent-guided intake.

## Scope
- Provide a stable external issue payload for testing.
- Validate provider detection from `origin`.
- Validate issue fetch by external ID (`#1`).
- Validate JSON output creation and naming convention.

## Out of Scope
- Real feature implementation.
- Production planning.
- Cross-team delivery commitments.
- External issue auto-closing behavior.

## Requirements
- `get_extern_issue.py --dev <slug> --extern-issue 1` must run successfully.
- Output file must be created at:
  - `yoda/project/extern-issues/github-1.json` (for GitHub origin)
  - or `yoda/project/extern-issues/gitlab-1.json` (for GitLab origin)
- The output must include key fields (provider, origin, external id, title, state, URL, body).

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Script fetches issue `#1` without parsing errors.
- [ ] JSON file is created in the expected folder with the expected filename.
- [ ] JSON content is valid and readable by `yoda_intake.py --extern-issue 1`.
- [ ] Intake runbook references the generated JSON file path.
- [ ] No external issue is closed automatically.

## Dependencies
- Authenticated CLI for the detected provider (`gh` or `glab`).
- Accessible repository remote (`origin`) configured.

## Risks and Edge Cases
- Missing CLI binary.
- Missing/expired auth token.
- Wrong repository `origin`.
- API/network restrictions in sandboxed environments.

## Test Notes
This issue is intentionally fake and exists only for workflow verification of external-issue intake.
